result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:11 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: B. Harris,  Defendant Nathan Daniel Nelson appeared by video.  Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore in court for Nathan Daniel Nelson.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim witness is present.  Court reviews file. ADA Smestad states all discovery has been sent.  Atty Larimore states he's received it and reviewed, does not believe there will be any motions.  Court will schedule next hearing in PSC block, DE can appear by zoom for next court date. DE needs to pay $75 for Atty Fee warrant, if it's not paid by next court date DE needs to be here in person. Atty Larimore to assist DE with payment and plans to reach out to Atty Krave to have him submit a final Atty bill.  Adjourned at 9:20 AM. bph

11:00 AM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel. Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Nathan Daniel Nelson appeared by video w/ Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore who also appeared by video.  INCLUDES: 22CF303 (PH) and 22TR2167. Court confirms address of DE. Atty Larimore notes PH on 22CF303 will be a waiver. Court advises DE of his right to appear in person. DE wishes to proceed by zoom. Crt finds Def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives preliminary hearing. Crt finds probable cause and binds Def over for trial. Atty Smestad states Information will mirror the complaint. Atty Larimore and DE would like to proceed with ARGN.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. 
As to 22TR2167, matter will trail along with 22CF303. Bond continues in form and amount. Adjourned: 11:08 am.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on June 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

03:04 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Holly Elkin Rockow, DE: Nathan Daniel Nelson pro se did not appear. Victim Witnes appeared. Court reviews case. Court notes missed scheduled court date. Court sets STC. Adjourned 03:09PM  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on May 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.  to Jail. Date missed scheduled. arc
Status conference on June 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

- Test clean before release.

- Not to possess any firearms.

-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Children C.J.N, J.M.N  and Mother K.N.P or residence, Champs bar staff LEA and MEL and Witness JMH and Champs .  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:04 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Brian Thomas Smestad, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF: Nathan Daniel Nelson appeared from jail. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD- PFAC given. Bond argument. Court orders bond. If any TR cases get filed. Enter NG pleas. Court sets STC. Adjourned  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
